channel.title: Moparisthebest Community Counter Strike: Source GunGame Server
channel.description:
This server is operated by TehSpede, t4 (myself), vortex, and Aff.
We're running Gungame w/ a few mods (such a healing on a knife kill, quake sounds, noblock, etc)
Come check us out or join the official channel #css on irc.uk.moparisthebest.xxx - [b]we even have a srcds irc bot that allows users to communicate in game via irc.[/b]
Connect via: [size=14pt]gg.gyrat.in[/size]
Our group: [size=14pt]http://steamcommunity.com/groups/gyratin[/size]
[quote="t4"]this game has been around for fucking ever, get it if you don't already have it.[/quote] [quote="Aff"][quote author=Fridder link=topic=530405.msg3872902#msg3872902 date=1325473005] Don't worry, neither have I.
Where do I download it? [/quote]
http://store.steampowered.com/css[/quote]

item.title: Moparisthebest Community Counter Strike: Source GunGame Server
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:77, topic:427712”][quote author=t4 link=topic=530405.msg3874937#msg3874937 date=1325613632]

That is the worst logic I have ever heard… If you could play on the server with a torrented copy of the game, why spend the $10 on it?

“I could have gotten this movie for free, but instead I bought it for $20, because that’s what real men do.”

You must be pretty damn retarded considering we’ve stated (multiple times) that you can’t play on the server with an illegitimate copy of the game.

he is talking about, why pay for something when it’s out there for free?
and I 100% agree, he isn’t talking about steam games. Torrents.

because a cracked version is a pain in the ass and the paid version is ACTUALLY worth the measly $10-20 (as far as content and hassle goes). besides, valve devs are very nice - they deserve it.
[/quote]

This

And especially since they put it for 50% off? Now thats a deal, 10 bucks for the game + an extra 2 for garrys mod, no problems in the game so far at all either, and im pretty much addicted. Plus yes its less of an hassle, especially me getting frustrated watching some shitty utube tut and forgetting to do a step, etc. paying $10 for constant updates beats going to find a newer version every time, following the tutorial, and it might even be different after the patch, etc.[/quote]
I meant games in particular, I would buy CSS but I am On BF3(torrented)
I am going to buy CSS soon

Read full topic
item.source: Moparisthebest Community Counter Strike: Source GunGame Server

“I could have gotten this movie for free, but instead I bought it for $20, because that’s what real men do.”

he is talking about, why pay for something when it’s out there for free?

because a cracked version is a pain in the ass and the paid version is ACTUALLY worth the measly $10-20 (as far as content and hassle goes). besides, valve devs are very nice - they deserve it.[/quote]

This

And especially since they put it for 50% off? Now thats a deal, 10 bucks for the game + an extra 2 for garrys mod, no problems in the game so far at all either, and im pretty much addicted. Plus yes its less of an hassle, especially me getting frustrated watching some shitty utube tut and forgetting to do a step, etc. paying $10 for constant updates beats going to find a newer version every time, following the tutorial, and it might even be different after the patch, etc.

item.title: Moparisthebest Community Counter Strike: Source GunGame Server
item.dc:creator: @Aff Aff
item.description:
@Aff wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:71, topic:427712”]he is talking about, why pay for something when it’s out there for free?
and I 100% agree, he isn’t talking about steam games. Torrents.[/quote]

He states that the benefits of using an illegitimate copy are the same as using one bought through steam (playing on the server), and says that the logic is retarded because of that. His entire point is that downloading a cracked version of a game is the exact same as paying for it; the statement is obviously invalid, and so the point he was trying to make isn’t proven (and thus false until proven otherwise ;))

item.title: Moparisthebest Community Counter Strike: Source GunGame Server
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:68, topic:427712”][quote author=`Alec link=topic=530405.msg3874498#msg3874498 date=1325562983]

Why buy it when you can torrent it…

alternatives to just buying the damn software, such as using torrents, is one hell of a terrible alternative. if you can’t buy it, then maybe you should consider getting a job (don’t ask mom–she gives you enough), and then paying for it like real men do.

That is the worst logic I have ever heard… If you could play on the server with a torrented copy of the game, why spend the $10 on it?

“I could have gotten this movie for free, but instead I bought it for $20, because that’s what real men do.”
[/quote]I agree, I say torrents are for people who have no jobs and an abundance of money.

Sure if I was Bieber, I’d buy my games, hell, I’d even buy my movies.

However, my copy of Counter Strike Source is legit, I managed to bypass Steam’s verification system back in 2008 and was able to use an already used key code of a source game pack (hl2, css, day of defeat source,…).

Today unfortunately, that is not possible anymore. I don’t really remember how I did it anyway. But that doesn’t matter, what matters is that it got me 5 premium Steam games for free. And it’s legit, no cracks whatsoever.

The only time I bought a game was back in 2007, when I bought a PSP and vice city stories.[/quote]
I have a hacked PSP and I have a 32gb mini sd card = win?
Torrents Ftw. If you were beiber you’d be a bitch (see what i did there)
But yeah, I 100% agree, you wouldn’t buy movies, you’d buy EVERYTHING.

Read full topic
item.source: Moparisthebest Community Counter Strike: Source GunGame Server

item.title: Moparisthebest Community Counter Strike: Source GunGame Server
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote="`Alec, post:1, topic:427871"][quote author=lemme_winks_ link=topic=530405.msg3873101#msg3873101 date=1325481441]

Why buy it when you can torrent it…

alternatives to just buying the damn software, such as using torrents, is one hell of a terrible alternative. if you can’t buy it, then maybe you should consider getting a job (don’t ask mom–she gives you enough), and then paying for it like real men do.
[/quote]

That is the worst logic I have ever heard… If you could play on the server with a torrented copy of the game, why spend the $10 on it?

“I could have gotten this movie for free, but instead I bought it for $20, because that’s what real men do.”[/quote]I agree, I say torrents are for people who have no jobs and an abundance of money.

Sure if I was Bieber, I’d buy my games, hell, I’d even buy my movies.

However, my copy of Counter Strike Source is legit, I managed to bypass Steam’s verification system back in 2008 and was able to use an already used key code of a source game pack (hl2, css, day of defeat source,…).

Today unfortunately, that is not possible anymore. I don’t really remember how I did it anyway. But that doesn’t matter, what matters is that it got me 5 premium Steam games for free. And it’s legit, no cracks whatsoever.

The only time I bought a game was back in 2007, when I bought a PSP and vice city stories.

Read full topic
